intro: Hypoporum leptostachyum, commonly known as the slender-stemmed hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or swampy areas.
